sentence: Stepan Company ( SCL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on February 25, 2015.
A cash dividend payment of $0.18 per share is scheduled to be paid on March 13, 2015.
Shareholders who purchased SCL prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 5.88% increase over the same period a year ago.
The previous trading day's last sale of SCL was $40.58, representing a -38.99% decrease from the 52 week high of $66.51 and a 11.67% increase over the 52 week low of $36.34.
SCL is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever PLC ( UL ).
SCL's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $2.49.
Zacks Investment Research reports SCL's forecasted earnings growth in 2015 as 19.05%, compared to an industry average of 2.9%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the SCL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
